sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: A fern is generated by applying the Barnsley fern algorithm 10,000 times, starting with a single point. How many distinct points are in the resulting fern?
message_2: The Barnsley fern algorithm generates a new point for each iteration. Since the algorithm is applied 10,000 times, starting with a single point, there will be a total of 10,001 distinct points in the resulting fern (including the initial point).
